intro: Orbexilum melanocarpum, commonly known as the black-fruited orbexilum, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its fruit is a distinctive, dark-colored capsule that splits open to release seeds. Orbexilum melanocarpum is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
